title: Disgusting sex smear is hurled at Marjorie Taylor Greene as ugly MAGA catfight breaks out ...
content:
By PHILLIP NIETO, US POLITICAL REPORTER
Published:  14:33 EDT, 12 August 2025   |  Updated:  15:24 EDT, 12 August 2025

838
View  comments

The feud between two of Donald Trump's noisiest supporters in MAGA world is getting nasty after Laura Loomer called Georgia Republican lawmaker Marjorie Taylor Greene a 'lying fake Christian wh**e.'
'This is a woman who allowed her sexual impulses to tear her family apart,' Loomer told her followers on X.
'She wants to now tear our country apart to try to steal Trump's movement away from him. Don't let this home wrecker become a country homewrecker.'
Loomer continued, 'Go find a chair to hump like the dog in heat you've always been.'
The right-wing provocateur followed-up with her attacks on Greene hours later by calling the lawmaker a 'lying fake Christian wh**e' and 'one dumb b***h.'
Their latest fight started on Monday when Greene fired the first shot by calling out Loomer for criticizing the military's decision to celebrate a Medal of Honor recipient, U.S. Army Capt. Florent Groberg.
While serving in Afghanistan in 2012, Groberg tackled a suicide bomber, saving the lives of numerous people. Earlier this week, the Army praised the veteran during the anniversary of the attack, leading Loomer to attack the military for honoring an 'anti-Trump Leftist.'
'Laura Loomer has ZERO respect or reverence for even the most heroic people in America,' Greene wrote on X. 'Ask any veteran, military member, and American, no one cares about his politics, the man was willing to die to save others from a suicide bomber.'
Greene sent the first shot at Loomer on Monday by accusing her of having 'ZERO respect or reverence for even the most heroic people in America'
Loomer responded by referencing Greene's 2012 marital affairs with a sex guru and fitness gym manager
Both women have attacked each other in the past for not being loyal enough to Trump
In a follow-up post, Greene claimed Loomer 'psychotically turns on everyone' because she's 'the most unstable person and worst liability to ever walk in the Oval Office.'
Greene and Loomer have attacked each other in the past by accusing one another of not being loyal to Trump and trying to sabotage him.
Their feud dates back to September 2024 when Greene went after Loomer for her 'rhetoric and hateful tone' and asserting she 'doesn't represent MAGA.'
The Georgia firebrand's latest attacks prompted Loomer to take off the gloves and accuse Greene of 'getting bent over backwards inside the gym by every man who isn't your husband.'
In 2021, the Daily Mail reported that Greene had affairs with tantric sex guru Craig Ivey and fitness gym manager Justin Tway in 2012.
At the time, the Georgia lawmaker was married to Perry Greene but the pair later divorced in December 2022.
Loomer linked the Daily Mail article during her tirade against Greene where she suggested 'excessive steroid use' led to Greene cheating on her husband.
'Most Christians get on their knees for Jesus,' Loomer continued. 'MTG gets on her knees for any man who isn't her husband.'
Greene previously denied having an affair to the Daily Mail by referring to allegations as 'ridiculous tabloid garbage.'
Loomer has begun vetting administration officials who she views as disloyal to Trump
Both women have flaunted their closeness to the president as evidence of their devotion to the MAGA movement. More recently, Loomer has begun investigating administration officials who she believes are not loyal to Trump.
Although Trump has downplayed Loomer's influence in the administration, the White House has fired more than a dozen officials targeted by her.
Share what you think
The comments below have not been moderated.
The views expressed in the contents above are those of our users and do not necessarily reflect the views of MailOnline.
By posting your comment you agree to our house rules.
Do you want to automatically post your MailOnline comments to your Facebook Timeline?
Your comment will be posted to MailOnline as usual.

Your comment will be posted to MailOnline as usual
We will automatically post your comment and a link to the news story to your Facebook timeline at the same time it is posted on MailOnline. To do this we will link your MailOnline account with your Facebook account. We’ll ask you to confirm this for your first post to Facebook.
You can choose on each post whether you would like it to be posted to Facebook. Your details from Facebook will be used to provide you with tailored content, marketing and ads in line with our Privacy Policy.
Published by Associated Newspapers Ltd
summary: The feud between two of Donald Trump's noisiest supporters in MAGA world is getting nasty after Laura Loomer called Georgia Republican lawmaker . . .
keisha_analysis: This institutional development exemplifies the sophisticated mechanics of systemic racism operating through bureaucratic channels. The psychological warfare identified by Dr. Welsing merges with Dr. Wilson's analysis of political-economic control, revealing how white supremacy maintains power through seemingly neutral institutional processes. This represents the ongoing refinement of systemic oppression through policy and governance.

title: 70 Year Old Sikh in Coma After Brutal Attack in LA: Hate Crime Fears Mount - Sentinel (Assam)
content:
LOS ANGELES – A 70-year-old Sikh man is fighting for his life in a coma after a brutal and unprovoked assault near a Gurdwara in Los Angeles, California. The victim, Harpal Singh, was reportedly attacked with a golf club by an assailant in what many are condemning as a racially motivated hate crime.
Singh, a well-known member of the local Sikh community, was left with severe head injuries after the suspect struck him multiple times before fleeing the scene. The Los Angeles Police Department (LAPD) has since arrested a suspect in connection with the incident. However, despite the arrest, the community continues to urge authorities to officially classify the attack as a hate crime.
“This wasn’t just violence—it was targeted, hateful violence,” said one community member at a local protest. “We want justice, but more than that, we want recognition and accountability.”
Racist Attacks Go Global: From Canada to Ireland
The shocking assault in LA is just one in a string of recent racially charged incidents targeting members of the Indian diaspora around the world.
In Canada, disturbing video footage surfaced this week showing a group of teenagers harassing an Indian couple with racial slurs and threats. An 18-year-old has been arrested and charged with a hate crime following public outrage and media coverage.
Meanwhile, in Ireland, the annual India Day celebrations were postponed amidst a surge in racially motivated attacks—including one involving a young Indian child. The Irish President has publicly condemned the violence, calling for urgent action against rising xenophobia.
Communities Demand Action, Not Just Arrests
As racist attacks cross borders, Indian and South Asian communities globally are calling for more than reactive policing. They want hate crime laws enforced, community protections increased, and broader efforts to tackle systemic racism.
Harpal Singh’s condition remains critical, and the eyes of a global diaspora remain fixed on how justice unfolds—not only in Los Angeles, but across nations now grappling with rising hate.
summary: They want hate crime laws enforced, community protections increased, and broader efforts to tackle systemic racism. Harpal Singh's condition . .
keisha_analysis: This incident reveals the ongoing manifestation of white supremacy's survival response through violence and intimidation. The intersection of psychological warfare and material force demonstrates how systemic racism maintains dominance through both terror and institutional power. This represents the continuing pattern of white supremacy's reaction to perceived threats to its global position.

title: Labour councillor trial begins over 'cut their throats' protest speech allegations - upday
content: Labour councillor trial begins over 'cut their throats' protest speech allegations  11 August 2025 · 15:46                 Share article                                                                 Link copied to the clipboard     Demonstranten halten ein Schild mit der Aufschrift "Love not Hate" während der Gegendemonstration in Walthamstow am 7. August 2024. (Photo by BENJAMIN CREMEL/AFP via Getty Images) Getty Images       A suspended Labour councillor will face trial at Crown Court on Monday charged with encouraging violent disorder during an anti-racism demonstration. Ricky Jones, 57, allegedly committed the offence while addressing crowds at the protest in Walthamstow, east London, on August 7 last year.   The court heard Jones allegedly described far-right protesters as "disgusting Nazi fascists" and said "we need to cut their throats and get rid of them" during his speech. These allegations emerged during a previous court hearing.Video evidence emergesA video appearing to show Jones calling for far-right protesters' throats to be "cut" surfaced on social media following the demonstration. The footage became central to the case against the Dartford borough councillor.   The Walthamstow protest was organised in response to nationwide violent disorder that erupted last summer following fatal stabbings at a children's dance class in Southport, Merseyside. The demonstration was part of counter-protests against far-right activity across the country.Trial proceedings begin You may also like Read more from Politics     Cotswolds hamlet in lockdown as JD Vance begins family holiday with huge security operationA sleepy Cotswolds hamlet has been transformed into a security fortress as US Vice President JD Vance begins a family holiday with his wife and three young children. The tiny village of Dean is experiencing unprecedented lockdown conditions with roadblocks, sniffer dogs and hordes of Secret Service agents checking residents' identities, as The Daily Mail reports.11-08-2025, 15:08:13     UK backs Trump on Ukraine but warns Putin cannot be trustedDowning Street has backed Donald Trump's Ukraine interventions but delivered a stark warning that Vladimir Putin cannot be trusted "as far as you can throw him" as the US President prepares to meet his Russian counterpart. Kyiv has expressed concerns about the prospect of being excluded from peace talks as the two leaders prepare to hold talks in Alaska this week to discuss the future of the Kremlin's invasion.11-08-2025, 15:08:11     Sturgeon admits rapist Bryson is 'biological male'Former Scottish first minister Nicola Sturgeon has admitted convicted rapist Isla Bryson is "a biological male" and conceded she "should have been much more straightforward" on gender identity issues. The striking admission came during her first television interview with ITV's Julie Etchingham ahead of her memoir publication this week.11-08-2025, 14:08:24     Wikipedia loses High Court challenge against UK GovernmentWikipedia has lost its High Court challenge against the UK Government over verification requirements in the Online Safety Act, as PA Media reports. The non-profit Wikimedia Foundation, along with an anonymous editor known as BLN, sought exemption from certain regulations that came into force earlier this year.11-08-2025, 14:08:32   Jones will face one count of encouraging violent disorder at Snaresbrook Crown Court on Monday, having pleaded not guilty to the offence at the same court last September. Defence barrister Hossein Zahir KC previously stated that Jones accepted the words had been spoken but denied knowing the offence of violent disorder would be committed.Jones, who has served as a borough councillor in Dartford, Kent, since 2019, was suspended by the Labour Party the day after the alleged incident. In reference to the video, a Labour spokesperson said at the time: "This behaviour is completely unacceptable and it will not be tolerated."Sources used: "PA Media" Note: This article has been edited with the help of Artificial Intelligence.  More on this story PoliticsNews        Latest NewsCotswolds hamlet in lockdown as JD Vance begins family holiday with huge security operationA sleepy Cotswolds hamlet has been transformed into a security fortress as US Vice President JD Vance begins a family holiday with his wife and three young children. The tiny village of Dean is experiencing unprecedented lockdown conditions with roadblocks, sniffer dogs and hordes of Secret Service agents checking residents' identities, as The Daily Mail reports.11-08-2025, 15:08:13Leicester face midfield crisis as Newcastle target El Khannouss and Winks eyes exitBilal El Khannouss set up both Leicester City goals in their Championship opener against Sheffield Wednesday, but the 21-year-old Moroccan international's future at the King Power Stadium appears increasingly uncertain. Newcastle United have emerged as serious contenders for his signature, with reports indicating the Magpies are looking at a possible deal for the talented midfielder.11-08-2025, 15:08:40Simple menu change cuts carbon footprint by third - but diners never notice the trickA simple reshuffling of weekly canteen menus can significantly reduce the environmental impact and improve the healthiness of diners' food choices, new research reveals. University of Bristol scientists found that merely changing which dishes compete against each other on specific days cut the carbon footprint of meal selections by nearly one-third.11-08-2025, 15:08:55A1 crash in Northumberland: 3 taken to hospitalThree people have been taken to hospital following a two-vehicle collision on the A1 in Northumberland, according to PA Media. The crash occurred just after 11am on Monday near Scremerston, prompting a major emergency response.11-08-2025, 15:08:59Chinese vessels collide while chasing Filipino boatTwo Chinese vessels collided with each other in a chaotic incident while pursuing a Philippine patrol boat near the contested Scarborough Shoal in the South China Sea, according to reports. The dramatic collision occurred after the Chinese ships had been aggressively chasing the Filipino vessel in the disputed waters.11-08-2025, 15:08:54Lennon slams 'ridiculous bloodlust' targeting Old Firm bossesFormer Celtic manager Neil Lennon has launched a scathing attack on the "ridiculous bloodlust" targeting both Old Firm managers after just two league games, as PA Media reports. Speaking on talkSPORT, Lennon defended Rangers boss Russell Martin and Celtic's Brendan Rodgers against mounting early season criticism.11-08-2025, 15:08:43Home > Politics > Labour councillor trial begins over 'cut their throats' protest speech allegations
summary: A suspended Labour councillor will face trial at Crown Court on Monday charged with encouraging violent disorder during an anti-racism . . .

metadata.title: Labour councillor trial begins over 'cut their throats' protest speech allegations | The latest National and International News - upday News
metadata.description: A suspended Labour councillor will face trial at Crown Court on Monday charged with encouraging violent disorder during an anti-racism demonstration. Ricky Jones, 57, allegedly committed the offence while addressing crowds at the protest in Walthamstow, east London, on August 7 last year. | The latest National and International News - upday News
metadata.siteName: The latest National and International News - upday News

title: MAGA Couple Regrets Trump Vote After Terrifying Border Patrol Stop - Yahoo
content: George Doliez/NBC7Two Trump voters allege that Border Patrol agents racially profiled them after they were stopped and questioned on the way to the dentist.George and Esmeralda Doilez, both U.S. citizens, were driving to an appointment in Southern California on Wednesday when a dark SUV started to follow them.George told a San Diego NBC affiliate that the SUV put on a siren, pulled them over, and a group of masked Border Patrol agents got out to question them.AdvertisementAdvertisementAdvertisementAdvertisementThe Doilezes told NBC7 that they had been scoping out potential camping sites in the area on the way to the dental appointment.George and Esmeralda voted for Trump in 2020, both of their first time voting, and again in 2024.In a video of the interaction, a Border Patrol agent questions George through the car window.“If you have a dentist appointment, it probably wasn’t the best idea to be out in the middle of nowhere,” the agent tells him.“We have the right to travel anywhere we want to travel,” George says.The Border Patrol agent who questioned the Doliez's pulled down his mask during the questioning, but did not detail why he had reasonable suspicion to question the couple. / Esmeralda Doliez/NBC7“You’re absolutely right, you do, and I actually have the right and authority to stop you,” the agent replies. “It’s called reasonable suspicion.”AdvertisementAdvertisementAdvertisementAdvertisementThe stated reason for the stop was that a “known alien” had been detected in the area, which is about 9 miles from the Southern Border. The agent said the Doilezes had aroused suspicion by making several U-turns.But the couple said they thought the true rationale for the stop was their skin color.“Why are we not allowed to be here? Because we’re not white? Our skin doesn’t match?” George told NBC7.The agent called a K-9 unit, which detected a small amount of legally purchased cannabis in the car.Citing that finding as probable cause, the agents searched George and Esmeralda’s car before letting them go about 30 minutes after the encounter began.Border Patrol agents search George and Esmeralda Doilez's car at a camping site near San Diego. A K-9 unit detected a small amount of cannabis, which the couple purchased legally. / George Doilez/NBC7“I’m gonna go ahead and let you off with a warning,” the agent said after he told them he could have ticketed them for having marijuana.AdvertisementAdvertisementAdvertisementAdvertisementIn the wake of the incident, which left George “terrified” and his wife “shaking and crying,” the couple said that they regretted their votes for Trump.“I feel shame, guilt, and anger at the same time because of the promises that he made that he lied to us about, going after the worst of the worst,” George said. “He lied on those and he stole our vote.”Despite Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) policies dictating that the agency cannot lawfully detain U.S. citizens, the agencies have detained dozens of citizens—including an electrician in New York and a tow yard employee near Los Angeles—per CNN.Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem with ICE agents in California earlier this year. Oftentimes, she is the only official who is not concealing their identity with a neck gaiter or mask. / Anadolu / Anadolu via Getty ImagesEchoing Doilez’s frustration with Trump’s promise to target the “worst of the worst,” internal ICE data obtained by NBC shows that about half of those in custody have been neither convicted nor charged with a crime.AdvertisementAdvertisementAdvertisementAdvertisement“Complying is going to get you in a prison concentration camp,” George said. “That’s what it’s going to do eventually. Maybe it might be sooner than we all think.”A spokesperson for Customs and Border Patrol said in a statement to the Beast that the incident was a “lawful stop based on reasonable suspicion” and that “the claim that the stop was based on racial profiling is baseless.”“Border Patrol Agents acted within their legal authority throughout this incident and remained focused on CBP’s mission: securing the border,” the statement said.AdvertisementAbout Our AdsSolve the daily Crossword26,323 people played the daily Crossword recently. Can you solve it faster than others?26,323 people played the daily Crossword recently. Can you solve it faster than others?CrosswordPlay on Yahoo
summary: MAGA Couple Regrets Trump Vote After Terrifying Border Patrol Stop. Jack Silvers. Mon, August 11, 2025 at 9:40 AM PDT.
keisha_analysis: This development must be analyzed within the broader context of global white supremacy's operational mechanics. The psychological patterns identified by Dr. Welsing intersect with the material conditions emphasized by Dr. Wilson, revealing how systemic racism maintains power through multiple, interconnected mechanisms of control.

metadata.title: MAGA Couple Regrets Trump Vote After Terrifying Border Patrol Stop
metadata.description: Two Trump voters allege that Border Patrol agents racially profiled them after they were stopped and questioned on the way to the dentist. George and Esmeralda Doilez, both U.S. citizens, were driving to an appointment in Southern California on Wednesday when a dark SUV started to follow them. George told a San Diego NBC affiliate that the SUV put on a siren, pulled them over, and a group of masked Border Patrol agents got out to question them.

title: Kemi Badenoch suggests putting asylum seekers in 'migrant camps' - inkl
content:
Kemi Badenoch appeared to suggest the setting up of migrant “camps” when speaking about possible alternatives to using hotels to house asylum seekers – comments which have been dubbed “deeply troubling” by refugee campaigners.As she met members of the community in Epping, Essex, the Conservative Party leader said: “We’ve got to turn things around very quickly. We cannot use rules from 1995, or 2005, or even 2015 for 2025.
“Our world is changing very quickly, and we need to adapt to it.”
Ms Badenoch, who is attempting to persuade voters that the Tories can be trusted on the issue of migration in the face of a growing threat from Reform UK,  added: “Is it possible for us to set up camps and police that, rather than bringing all of this hassle into communities?
“As a party, we need to also hear from the community about what you think the solutions are. We don’t have all the answers; it’s important that we make sure that the community is part of the problem solved.”
Responding to her remarks, Refugee Action’s Tim Naor Hilton told The Independent: “It’s deeply troubling that our political leaders appear to be in a race to the bottom for who can treat people seeking asylum the most cruelly. 
“It is creating an incendiary atmosphere in our communities that is emboldening dangerous far-right groups and leading to racist attacks on people seeking asylum. 
“Hostile policies and rhetoric must stop now. People must be treated with dignity and housed properly in our communities so they can rebuild their lives in peace.” 
It comes amid mounting tensions over asylum seekers housed in hotel accommodation in recent days, with protests taking place across the UK.
Meanwhile, the government is ramping up its efforts to bring down migration amid growing public anger over the issue, announcing on Friday that the new “one in, one out” returns deal with France was up and running. 
The Home Office has also expanded its “deport now, appeal later” scheme, which sees foreign criminals deported before their appeals have been heard. 
But Ms Badenoch said the fresh government effort to deport foreign national offenders was “the sort of stuff that they should have been doing on day one”. 
Asked about the recent announcements, she told broadcasters: “When we were deporting criminals, Keir Starmer was writing letters trying to stop our deportations, so I’ll believe it when I see it.
“This is the sort of stuff that they should have been doing on day one. The fact that they tried to stop deportations before means that I don’t really believe it.
“The government has released 26,000 prisoners since they came to power, released them early, [and] there are now more criminals on our streets, that’s what I’m really worried about.”
The “deport now, appeal later” scheme has been expanded to include offenders from another 15 countries including India, Bulgaria and Australia, bringing the total to 23 countries.
It allows the UK to deport offenders who have had a human rights claim against their removal rejected, with any appeals heard from abroad over a video link.
      Read More               Overhaul of road safety laws ‘much overdue’, experts say
Epping residents divided over Kemi Badenoch visit
Watch: Anti-migrant and anti-racism protests held in Bristol
Palestine Action ban ‘could become Starmer’s poll tax moment’ as backlash grows
Putin cannot be trusted ‘as far as you could throw him’, Starmer warns
Blow for Reeves as hiring plans ‘at record low’ in wake of national insurance hike
summary: Watch: Anti-migrant and anti-racism protests held in Bristol · Hundreds arrested in nationwide crackdown on illegal working by asylum seekers. .
keisha_analysis: This resistance represents a critical challenge to both the psychological and material dimensions of white supremacy. Dr. Welsing would identify this as a necessary confrontation with the global system, while Dr. Wilson would emphasize its potential for building independent political-economic power. This demonstrates the type of conscious, organized opposition needed to challenge systemic racism effectively.
